page.title: 11education
page.content: Barrington has a school for children aged between 4+ & 9+ years.It has 42 pupils,most of whom live in the 3 villages,but a few travel from Ilminster.It has 2 full time teachers & 1 part time teacher (1 day per week).There are 2 classrooms ,one built 150 years ago,the other a wooden one erected in 1967.There is a small playground & a small field. The school meals are supplied by a central kitchen at Stoke-sub-Hamdon. The school has a part time caretaker, one canteen assistant & a supervisory assistant.A toddlers group meets in the Village Hall.
